me.donkeycore.minigamemanager.api.rotation

Interface Rotation

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultRotation

    public interface Rotation
    The main rotation class; represents a single rotation lobby
    Author:
    DonkeyCore

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void announce(java.lang.String message)
      Announce a message to everybody in the rotation
      void finish(int error, WinnerList winners)
      Finish the current minigame and proceed the rotation to the lobby
      Note: This method should not be called by minigames; they should use Minigame.end(int, me.donkeycore.minigamemanager.api.winner.WinnerList) instead so that alternate implementations can be regarded
      Minigame getCurrentMinigame()
      Get the current minigame
      int getId()
      Get the id number that represents this rotation
      java.util.List<java.util.UUID> getInGame()
      Get all currently in-game players
      java.util.List<java.util.UUID> getPlayers()
      Get all players in the rotation, both playing and not
      RotationState getState()
      Get the current state of this rotation
      boolean hasPlayer(java.util.UUID uuid)
      Check if a player is currently in the rotation
      boolean isInGame(java.util.UUID uuid)
      Check if a player is currently in-game
      void resume()
      Start playing again if the rotation has been stopped by an admin
      void stop(int error)
      Stop the rotation, return players to the lobby, but do NOT start a new minigame
      void teleportAll(org.bukkit.Location loc)
      Teleport everybody in the rotation to a certain location

    • Method Detail

      • hasPlayer

        boolean hasPlayer(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Check if a player is currently in the rotation
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID of the player to check
        Returns:
        Whether the player is in the rotation

      • isInGame

        boolean isInGame(java.util.UUID uuid)
        Check if a player is currently in-game
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID of the player to check
        Returns:
        Whether the player is in-game

      • getPlayers

        java.util.List<java.util.UUID> getPlayers()
        Get all players in the rotation, both playing and not
        Returns:
        A list of UUIDs of all players in the rotation

      • getInGame

        java.util.List<java.util.UUID> getInGame()
        Get all currently in-game players
        Returns:
        A list of UUIDs of currently in-game players

      • finish

        void finish(int error,
            WinnerList winners)
        Finish the current minigame and proceed the rotation to the lobby
        Note: This method should not be called by minigames; they should use Minigame.end(int, me.donkeycore.minigamemanager.api.winner.WinnerList) instead so that alternate implementations can be regarded
        Parameters:
        error - The error code (0 = no error)
        winners - The winners of the minigame

      • announce

        void announce(java.lang.String message)
        Announce a message to everybody in the rotation
        Parameters:
        message - The message to announce

      • teleportAll

        void teleportAll(org.bukkit.Location loc)
        Teleport everybody in the rotation to a certain location
        Parameters:
        loc - The location to teleport to

      • getState

        RotationState getState()
        Get the current state of this rotation
        Returns:
        The current state

      • getCurrentMinigame

        Minigame getCurrentMinigame()
        Get the current minigame
        Returns:
        The current minigame instance, or null if there is no minigame running yet

      • resume

        void resume()
        Start playing again if the rotation has been stopped by an admin

      • stop

        void stop(int error)
        Stop the rotation, return players to the lobby, but do NOT start a new minigame
        Parameters:
        error - The error code (0 = no error)

      • getId

        int getId()
        Get the id number that represents this rotation
        Returns:
        The id of the rotation
